    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public FedoraResponse execute(FedoraRequest<?> method)
                       throws FedoraClientException
        Convenience method for executing FedoraRequests. Note that this method returns a FedoraResponse and therefore requires an explicit cast if a specific implementation of FedoraResponse is desired.

        The preferred usage is actually the reverse: pass an instance of FedoraClient to the FedoraRequest, e.g.

            IngestResponse r = new Ingest("my:pid").execute(client);

        As a further shorthand, if the default instance of FedoraClient that FedoraRequests should use is set (FedoraRequest.setDefaultClient(FedoraClient)), then you can use the following:

            IngestResponse r = new Ingest("my:pid").execute();

        Finally, FedoraClient provides a number of static convenience methods for FedoraRequests. Therefore, with a static import, the following, abbreviated syntax can be used:

        import static com.yourmediashelf.fedora.client.FedoraClient.*;
 ...
     IngestResponse r = ingest("my:pid").execute();
        Parameters:
        method - a FedoraRequest
        Returns:
        the wrapped HTTP response
        Throws:
        FedoraClientException

      • getLastModifiedDate

        public Date getLastModifiedDate(String pid)
                         throws FedoraClientException

        Convenience method for returning the lastModifiedDate of an object.

        Equivalent to getObjectProfile(pid).execute().getLastModifiedDate().

        Parameters:
        pid - the pid of the object
        Returns:
        the lastModifiedDate of the requested object
        Throws:
        FedoraClientException

      • getLastModifiedDate

        public Date getLastModifiedDate(String pid,
                       String dsId)
                         throws FedoraClientException

        Convenience method for returning the lastModifiedDate of a datastream.

        Equivalent to getDatastream(pid, dsId).execute().getLastModifiedDate().

        Parameters:
        pid - the pid of the object
        dsId - the datastream ID
        Returns:
        the lastModifiedDate of the requested datastream
        Throws:
        FedoraClientException

      • debug

        public void debug(boolean debug)
        If enabled, adds a logging filter to all requests that outputs to System.out.
        Parameters:
        debug - true to enable debugging

      • getServerVersion

        public String getServerVersion()
                        throws FedoraClientException
        Get the version of the Fedora Repository this client is associated with as reported by DescribeRepository
        Returns:
        the version of the Fedora Repository this client is associated with.
        Throws:
        FedoraClientException

      • addDatastream

        public static AddDatastream addDatastream(String pid,
                          String dsId)

        Static convenience method for the AddDatastream request.

        Equivalent to invoking: new AddDatastream(pid, dsId).

        Parameters:
        pid - the pid of the object to add the datastream to.
        dsId - the identifier of the datastream to be added.
        Returns:
        builder for the AddDatastream method
        See Also:
        AddDatastream

      • addRelationship

        public static AddRelationship addRelationship(String subject)

        Static convenience method for the AddRelationship request.

        Equivalent to invoking: new AddRelationship(subject).

        Parameters:
        subject - the subject of the object (e.g. demo:123 or info:fedora/demo:123/DC)
        Returns:
        builder for the AddRelationship method
        See Also:
        AddRelationship
